page.title: 20Guisborough Moorland
page.content: We studied 4 1-metre-squares of moor- land just to the S.of Guisborough for- est & near Hutton.We recorded the plants/animals & their abundance. The pH of the soil was 5.5.This acidity is due to lack of calcium. 1 square was wet & contained: Calluna vulgaris; Empetrum nigrum; Erica Tetralix; Sph- agnum moss;reeds;liverwort;hay ticks; cuckoo spit.The other 3 contained: Calluna vul.(abundant);Empet.nig.(ab); Montia Fontand(rare);Spaghnum moss(ab);Cuckoo spit;hay ticks. 2 visits were made to the moor, on 4.7.85 & 14.7.85.The latter was helpful because Calluna vul.& Erica tet. were in flower making them easy to identify.Sounds or traces of pheasant,grouse & curlew were also noted,& the moor was grazed by sheep.
